mip.description: LUMIP is a suite of experiments focused on land use, including both idealized and realistic scenarios with and without transient land use.
mip.keywords: land use, land management, land cover, land policy
mip.label: LUMIP
mip.rationale: Quantifying the effects of land use on climate and biogeochemical cycling (past–future), and assessing the potential for alternative land management strategies to mitigate climate change.

ssp126-ssp370Lu.description: Keep all forcings the same as ScenarioMIP SSP1-2.6 (aforestation scenario), but replace land use with SSP3-7.0 (deforestation) scenario.  Concentration driven.
ssp126-ssp370Lu.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 1, Scenario,  SSP1-2.6 forcing and SSP3-7.0 land use
ssp126-ssp370Lu.rationale: Land-use policy sensitivity simulation for the low radiative forcing scenario.

land-hist-altStartYear.description:
Land surface model simulation. Same as land-hist except starting from either 1700 (for models that typically start in 1850) or 1850 (for models that typically start in 1700).   Use the same land model configuration as used in the coupled CMIP6 historical simulations. Include representation of land cover, land use and land management. All applicable land use features should be active.  Forced with historical observed climate. Include transient CO2, Nitrogen deposition, aerosol deposition and population density. 
This experiment can and likely will be a different configuration across models due to different representations of land use for each model.
land-hist-altStartYear.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 1, historical, All Management, AM, All  LULCC, 1700, 1850
land-hist-altStartYear.rationale: Land cover versus land management change. To assess the relative impact of land cover and incrementally more comprehensive land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon. Comparison with land-hist indicates impact of pre-1850 land use change.

land-noShiftcultivate.description: Land surface model simulation. Same as land-hist except shifting cultivation turned off. (i.e. with net transitions instead of gross).  Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model.
land-noShiftcultivate.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 2, historical, grassland, net transitions, no land management
land-noShiftcultivate.long_name: historical land-only with shifting cultivation turned off
land-noShiftcultivate.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

land-crop-noIrrig.description: Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except with irrigated area held at 1850 levels. Irrigation amounts within the 1850 irrigated area are allowed to change. Only relevant if land-hist utilises at least some form of crop management (e.g. planting and harvesting).  Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model.
land-crop-noIrrig.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

land-crop-noIrrigFert.description: Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except irrigated area and fertiliser area/use should be held constant at 1850 levels.  Irrigation amounts within the 1850 irrigated area are allowed to change.  Only relevant if land-hist utilises at least some form of crop management (e.g. planting and harvesting).  Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model.
land-crop-noIrrigFert.long_name: historical land-only with no irrigation and no fertilisation
land-crop-noIrrigFert.rationale: Factorial set of land only experiments with increasingly realistic treatment of land management.

land-crop-grass.description: Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except with all new crop and pasture-land treated as unmanaged grassland. Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model.
land-crop-grass.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 2, historical, grassland, no land management
land-crop-grass.long_name: historical land-only with cropland as natural grassland
land-crop-grass.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

land-noWoodHarv.description: Land surface model simulation. Same as land-hist except with wood harvest maintained at 1850 amounts/areas.  Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model.
land-noWoodHarv.long_name: historical land-only with no wood harvest
land-noWoodHarv.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

land-hist.description:
Land surface model simulation.  Use the same land model configuration as used in the coupled CMIP6 historical simulations. Include representation of land cover, land use and land management. All applicable land use features should be active. Forced with historical observed climate. Include all transient forcings that are relevant for the land model such as CO2 concentration, Nitrogen deposition, aerosol deposition, population density. Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model. This experiment is shared with the LS3MIP, note that LS3MIP expects the start year to be 1850.   
This experiment can and likely will be a different configuration across models due to different representations of land use for each model.
land-hist.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 1, LS3MIP, Tier 1, historical, All Management, AM, All  LULCC, 1850, 1700
land-hist.rationale: Offline land simulations of land surface states and fluxes allow for the evaluation of trends and variability of snow, soil moisture and land surface fluxes, carbon stores and vegetation states, and climate change impacts. To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments. Comparison with land-hist-altStartYear indicates impact of pre-1850 land use.

esm-ssp585-ssp126Lu.description: Keep all forcings the same as C4MIP esm-ssp585 scenario, but replace land use with ScenarioMIP SSP1-2.6  (aforestation) scenario. Emission driven.
esm-ssp585-ssp126Lu.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 1, Scenario, SSP5-8.5 forcing and SSP1-2.6 land use
esm-ssp585-ssp126Lu.long_name: emissions-driven SSP5-8.5 with SSP1-2.6 land use
esm-ssp585-ssp126Lu.rationale: Land-use policy sensitivity simulation for high radiative forcing scenario.

land-hist-altLu1.description:
Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except using alternative high land-use history reconstructions that span uncertainty in agriculture and wood harvest.  Note that land use in 1700 and 1850 will be different to that in land-hist so model will need to be spun up again for each alternative dataset. Use the same land model configuration as used in the coupled CMIP6 historical simulations. Include representation of land cover, land use and land management. All applicable land use features should be active. 
This experiment can and likely will be a different configuration across models due to different representations of land use for each model.
land-hist-altLu1.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 2, historical, All Management, 1850, 1700, high land use
land-hist-altLu1.long_name: historical land-only with high land use
land-hist-altLu1.rationale: In combination with land-hist, allows assessment of model sensitivity to different assumptions about land-use history reconstructions.  These reconstructions do not span the entire range of uncertainty, the simulations should be considered sensitivity simulations.

land-noPasture.description: Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except with grazing and other management on pastureland helt at 1850 levels/distribution. i.e. all new pastureland treated as unmanaged grassland (as in land-crop-grass). Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model.
land-noPasture.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

land-noFire.description: Land surface model simulation. Same as land-hist except with fire management maintained at 1850 levels. Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model.
land-noFire.long_name: historical land-only with no human fire land management
land-noFire.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

deforest-globe.description: Idealized deforestation experiment. 20 million square km forest area (covered by trees) is converted to natural unmanaged grassland over a period of 50 years with a linear rate of 400000 km2/yr followed by 30 years of constant forest cover. Run for 80 years. Simulations should be branched from an 1850 control simulation (piControl) at least 80 years prior to the end of the piControl simulation so that deforest-globe and piControl can be directly compared.  All pre-industrial forcings including CO2 concentration and land-use maps and land management should be maintained as in the piControl.  Deforestation should be restricted to the top 30% of land grid cells in terms of their area of tree cover.  Effectively this concentrates deforestation in the tropical rainforest and boreal forest regions.
deforest-globe.rationale: Idealised deforestation experiment designed to gain process understanding and to assess the biogeophysical role of land cover change on climate. To inter-compare modeled biogeochemical response to deforestation. To Identify what amount of deforestation is required to see a signal relative to noise.  Designed to be somewhat analogous/complementary to the 1% CO2 DECK experiments.

piControl.description: A pre-inudsutrial control simulation with non-evolving pre-industrial conditions. Conditions chosen to be representative of the period prior to the onset of large-scale industrialization, with 1850 being the reference year.  The piControl starts after an initial climate spin-up, during which the climate begins to come into balance with the forcing. The recommended minimum length for the piControl is 500 years.
piControl.keywords: CMIP, Tier 1, DECK, Diagnosis Evaluation and Characterization of Klima (Climate), pre-industrial, reference, control, climate,
piControl.rationale: Control experiment against which perturbations are compared, it serves as a baseline for experiments that branch from it.  To allow us to determine unforced model variability.  The control experiment should be long enough to extend to the furthest point in time reached by the end of the perturbation experiments,  thus the control should allow us to subtract any residual, unforced drift from all perturbation simulations.

land-cCO2.description:
Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except with CO2 held constant. Branch from end of land-hist spin-up period.  Use the same land model configuration as used in the coupled CMIP6 historical simulations. Include representation of land cover, land use and land management. All applicable land use features should be active. Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model. 
This experiment can and likely will be a different configuration across models due to different representations of land use for each model.
land-cCO2.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 2, historical, Constant CO2, constant carbon dioxide concentration, 1850, 1700
land-cCO2.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

land-cClim.description:
Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except with climate held constant. Branch from end of land-hist spin-up period and continue with spin-up forcing looping over the first 20 years of meteorological forcing data.  Use the same land model configuration as used in the coupled CMIP6 historical simulations. Include representation of land cover, land use and land management. All applicable land use features should be active. Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model. 
This experiment can and likely will be a different configuration across models due to different representations of land use for each model.
land-cClim.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

land-crop-noFert.description: Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except with fertilisation area held at 1850 levels/distribution. Only relevant if land-hist utilises at least some form of crop management (e.g. planting and harvesting).  Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model.
land-crop-noFert.rationale: To assess the relative impact of land cover and incremental land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon in combination with other LUMIP land experiments.

ssp370-ssp126Lu.description: Keep all forcings the same as ScenarioMIP SSP3-7.0 (deforestation scenario), but replace land use with SSP1-2.6 (aforestation) scenario.  Concentration driven.  Additional ensemble members are requested with tier 2 priority.
ssp370-ssp126Lu.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 1, Tier 2, Scenario, SSP3-7.0 forcing and SSP1-2.6 land use
ssp370-ssp126Lu.rationale: Land-use policy sensitivity simulation for the high radiative forcing scenario.

land-noLu.description:
Land surface model simulation. Historical forcing with land use held constant at 1850. Same as land-hist except no land use change.  Include representation of land cover, land use and land management. All applicable land use features should be active. Forced with historical observed climate. Include transient CO2, Nitrogen deposition, aerosol deposition etc. Start year either 1850 or 1700 depending on standard practice for particular model. This experiment is shared with the LS3MIP, note that LS3MIP expects the start year to be 1850.   
This experiment can and likely will be a different configuration across models due to different representations of land use for each model.
land-noLu.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 1, Historical, pre-industrial Land Use and Land Cover, 1850, no land use change
land-noLu.long_name: historical land-only with no land-use change
land-noLu.rationale: Land-use change impact on land to atmosphere fluxes of water, energy and carbon.

hist-noLu.description: Concentration driven historical forcing with land use held constant at 1850 usage.  Same as the concentration diriven CMIP6 historical experiment except with land use and land cover change (LULCC) held constant at pre-industrial conditions. Additional ensemble members are requested with tier 2 priority.
hist-noLu.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 1, Tier 2, Historical, pre-industrial Land Use and Land Cover, 1850 LULCC
hist-noLu.rationale: Land-use change impact on past climate.

land-hist-altLu2.description:
Land surface model simulation.  Same as land-hist except using alternative low land-use history reconstructions that span uncertainty in agriculture and wood harvest.  Note that land use in 1700 and 1850 will be different to that in land-hist so model will need to be spun up again for each alternative dataset. Use the same land model configuration as used in the coupled CMIP6 historical simulations. Include representation of land cover, land use and land management. All applicable land use features should be active. 
This experiment can and likely will be a different configuration across models due to different representations of land use for each model.
land-hist-altLu2.keywords: LUMIP, Tier 2, historical, All Management, 1850, 1700, low land use
land-hist-altLu2.long_name: historical land-only with low land use
land-hist-altLu2.rationale: In combination with land-hist, allows assessment of model sensitivity to different assumptions about land-use history reconstructions.  These reconstructions do not span the entire range of uncertainty, the simulations should be considered sensitivity simulations.

historical.description:
Simulation of recent past (1850 to 2014). 
Impose changing conditions (consistent with observations). Should be initialised from a point early enough in the pre-industrial control run to ensure that the end of all the perturbed runs branching from the end of this historical run end before the end of the control.
historical.long_name: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
historical.rationale: Spans the period of extensive instrumental temperature measurements from 1850 to the present. Evaluate model performance against present climate and observed climate change.

historicalGSWP3Forcing.data_link: Global Soil Wetness Project Phase 3 Website
historicalGSWP3Forcing.description: Apply Global Soil Wetness Project phase three (GSWP3) forcing data for offline land surface models running the LS3MIP historical simulation land-hist is provided by the LS3MIP.
historicalGSWP3Forcing.label: Historical GSWP3 Meteorological Forcing

AOGCMconfiguration.description: Use a coupled Atmosphere-Ocean general circulation model
AOGCMconfiguration.label: AOGCM Configuration

allLandManagement.description: All applicable land management active in the land surface model configuration.
allLandManagement.keywords: LUMIP, all land management, Grassland, Fire, Wood Harvest, Pasture, Crop, Irrigation, Fertilisation
allLandManagement.label: All Land Management Active

HistoricalLandUse.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
HistoricalLandUse.description: Apply the global gridded land-use forcing datasets to link historical land-use data and future projections.  This new generation of “land use harmonization” (LUH2) builds upon past work from CMIP5, and includes updated inputs, higher spatial resolution, more detailed land-use transitions, and the addition of important agricultural management layers.
HistoricalLandUse.label: Historical Land Use

HistoricalSolarIrradiance.data_link: SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMIP6
HistoricalSolarIrradiance.description: The standard solar forcing dataset recommended for usage is the solar reference scenario dataset which consists of historical reconstructions (1850-2014).  Includes total solar irradiance, F10.7 cm solar radio flux, and spectral solar irradiance for 10-100000 nm range.
HistoricalSolarIrradiance.keywords: Solar Forcing, Historical, Solar, Spectral Irradiance, SSI, TSI
HistoricalSolarIrradiance.label: Historical Solar Irradiance Forcing

80yrs1850-1929.description: Begin in 1850 and run for 80 years.
80yrs1850-1929.label: 1850-1929 80yrs

piSolarParticleForcing.description: Pre-Industrial solar particle forcing (1850-1873 mean). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
piSolarParticleForcing.keywords: Solar forcing, Pre-Industrial, pi, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
piSolarParticleForcing.label: Pre-Industrial Solar Particle Forcing

165yrs1850-2014.keywords: 1850, 2014, Historical, Recent Past, pre-industrial to present, IPCC
165yrs1850-2014.label: 1850-2014 165yrs

PreIndustrialLandUse.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
PreIndustrialLandUse.label: Pre-Industrial Land Use

historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoCO2.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoCO2.description: Apply all transient historical forcings that are relevant for the land surface model except carbon dioxide (CO2). Include transient Nitrogen deposition, aerosol deposition and population density etc.
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoCO2.keywords: LUMIP, historical, land surface forcing, no CO2
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoCO2.label: Historical land surface forcings except CO2

transientFertilisation.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
transientFertilisation.label: Historical Transient Fertilisation

HistoricalSolarParticleForcing.description: Historical solar particle forcing (1850-2014). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
HistoricalSolarParticleForcing.keywords: Solar forcing, Historical, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
HistoricalSolarParticleForcing.label: Historical Solar Particle Forcing

trendyInterimForcingGSWP3HighLandUse.description: For the interim period from 1700 to the first year of the GSWP3 high land use forcing, the forcing data should continue to be recycled but all other forcings (CO2, etc.) should be as in the piControl simulation. Use high estimates for land use  (crop, pasture and wood harvest).
trendyInterimForcingGSWP3HighLandUse.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, 1700 to first forcing year, interim forcing, GSWP3, high land use
trendyInterimForcingGSWP3HighLandUse.label: TRENDY Interim Forcing for GSWP3 high land use

trendySpinUpGSWP3LowLandUse.description: Spin up of the land surface model should follow the TRENDY protocol which calls for recycling of the climate mean and variability from two decades of the GSWP3 forcing dataset (1831–1850). CO2 and all other forcings should be held constant at 1850 levels during spinup.  Land use should be held constant with low estimates for 1850 crop cultivation, pasture land and wood harvest.
trendySpinUpGSWP3LowLandUse.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, spin up, GSWP3, low land use
trendySpinUpGSWP3LowLandUse.label: TRENDY spin up for GSWP3 low land use

rcp70ForcingExcludingLandUse.description: Impose RCP7.0 forcing excluding land use. Concentration driven.
rcp70ForcingExcludingLandUse.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 7.0, future, 21st century, SSP3, RCP7.0, excluding land use
rcp70ForcingExcludingLandUse.label: RCP70 Forcing Excluding Land Use

allHistoricalLandSurfaceForcings.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
allHistoricalLandSurfaceForcings.description: Apply all transient historical forcings that are relevant for the land surface model. Include transient CO2, Nitrogen deposition, aerosol deposition and population density etc.
allHistoricalLandSurfaceForcings.keywords: LUMIP, historical, land surface forcing, all forcings
allHistoricalLandSurfaceForcings.label: All historical land surface forcings

historicalLandUseHigh.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandUseHigh.description: Historical land use with high estimates of crop cultivation, pasture land and wood harvest.
historicalLandUseHigh.keywords: LUMIP, historical land use, high estimate, crop, pasture, wood harvest
historicalLandUseHigh.label: Historical Land Use High

rcp26ForcingExcludingLandUse.description: Impose RCP2.6 forcing excluding land use. Concentration driven.
rcp26ForcingExcludingLandUse.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 2.6, future, 21st century, SSP1, RCP2.6, excluding land use
rcp26ForcingExcludingLandUse.label: RCP26 Forcing Excluding Land Use

trendyInterimForcingGSWP3.description: For the interim period from 1700 to the first year of the GSWP3 forcing dataset, the forcing data should continue to be recycled but all other forcings (land-use, CO2, etc.) should be as in the piControl simulation.
trendyInterimForcingGSWP3.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, 1700 to first forcing year, interim forcing, GSWP3
trendyInterimForcingGSWP3.label: TRENDY Interim Forcing for GSWP3

GSWP3RecycleClimateMeanAndVariability.data_link: Global Soil Wetness Project Phase 3 Website
GSWP3RecycleClimateMeanAndVariability.description: Recycling of the climate mean and variability from two decades (1831–1850) of the GSWP3 dataset (Global Soil Wetness Project Phase 3). The recycled variables are the forcing variables needed to drive an offline land module. So these are wind speed in two directions at 10m height, atmosphere temperature and humidity at 2m height, incoming shortwave and longwave radiation, incoming rainfall and snowfall, surface pressure.
GSWP3RecycleClimateMeanAndVariability.keywords: TRENDY, GSWP3, recycle climate mean, recycle climate variability
GSWP3RecycleClimateMeanAndVariability.label: GSWP3 recycling of climate mean and variability

historicalLandUseNoShiftCultivation.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandUseNoShiftCultivation.description: Historical land use except shifting cultivation is turned off. (i.e. crop and pasture use net transitions instead of gross).
historicalLandUseNoShiftCultivation.keywords: LUMIP, historical land use, no shifting cultivation, net transitions
historicalLandUseNoShiftCultivation.label: Historical land use except no shifting cultivation

trendySpinUpGSWP3HighLandUse.description: Spin up of the land surface model should follow the TRENDY protocol which calls for recycling of the climate mean and variability from two decades of the GSWP3 forcing dataset (1831–1850). CO2 and all other forcings should be held constant at 1850 levels during spinup.  Land use should be held constant with high estimates for 1850 crop cultivation, pasture land and wood harvest.
trendySpinUpGSWP3HighLandUse.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, spin up, GSWP3, high land use
trendySpinUpGSWP3HighLandUse.label: TRENDY spin up for GSWP3 high land use

historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoIrrigFert.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoIrrigFert.description: Apply all transient historical forcings that are relevant for the land surface model except for irrigation and fertilisation.
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoIrrigFert.keywords: LUMIP, historical, land surface forcing, no irrigation, no fertilisation
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoIrrigFert.label: Historical land surface forcings except irrigation and fertilisation

historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoFire.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoFire.description: Apply all transient historical forcings that are relevant for the land surface model except for fire management.
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoFire.keywords: LUMIP, historical, land surface forcing, no fire management
historicalLandSurfaceForcingsNoFire.label: Historical land surface forcings except fire management

FutureSolarParticleForcing.description: Future solar particle forcing (2015-2299). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
FutureSolarParticleForcing.keywords: Solar forcing, Future, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
FutureSolarParticleForcing.label: Future Solar Particle Forcing

historicalLandUsePastureAsGrassland.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandUsePastureAsGrassland.description: Historical land use except treat all new pastureland as unmanaged grassland.
historicalLandUsePastureAsGrassland.keywords: LUMIP, historical land use, pasture as unmanaged grassland
historicalLandUsePastureAsGrassland.label: Historical land use except with pasture as grassland

RCP70land.description: Impose changing RCP7.0 land use including crops, pasture, urban area, vegetation and forest.
RCP70land.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 7.0, future, 21st century, SSP3, RCP7.0, Land Use
RCP70land.label: RCP70 Land Use

1850Fertilisation.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
1850Fertilisation.label: 1850 Fertilisation

RCP26land.description: Impose changing RCP2.6 land use including crops, pasture, urban area, vegetation and forest.
RCP26land.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 2.6, future, 21st century, SSP1, RCP2.6, Land Use
RCP26land.label: RCP26 Land Use

1850Irrigation.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
1850Irrigation.description: Maintain 1850 irrigated area.  Irrigation amounts within the irrigated area are allowed to change.
1850Irrigation.label: 1850 Irrigation

piLandUseExcludingForestGrassland.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
piLandUseExcludingForestGrassland.description: Constant pre-industrial land use, excluding forest and natural grassland.
piLandUseExcludingForestGrassland.keywords: LUMIP, pre-industrial land-use, excluding forest, excluding natural grassland
piLandUseExcludingForestGrassland.label: Pre-Industrial Land Use Excluding Forest And Grassland

HistoricalO3andStratosphericH2OConcentra.description: An ozone concentration database encompassing both the stratosphere and the troposphere and a stratospheric water vapour concentration database.
HistoricalO3andStratosphericH2OConcentra.keywords: Historical, stratospheric, ozone, water vapour, O3, H2O, concentration
HistoricalO3andStratosphericH2OConcentra.label: Historical O3 and Stratospheric H2O Concentrations

86yrs2015-2100.description: Scenario, from 2015 to the end of the 21st century.
86yrs2015-2100.label: 2015-2100 86yrs

ESMconfiguration.description: Use a fully coupled Earth system model
ESMconfiguration.label: ESM Configuration

trendySpinUpGSWP3.description: Spin up of the land surface model should follow the TRENDY protocol which calls for recycling of the climate mean and variability from two decades of the GSWP3 forcing dataset (1831–1850). Land use should be held constant at 1850 as in the DECK 1850 coupled control simulation (piControl). CO2 and all other forcings should be held constant at 1850 levels during spinup.
trendySpinUpGSWP3.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, spin up, GSWP3
trendySpinUpGSWP3.label: TRENDY spin up for GSWP3

HistoricalStratosphericAerosol.data_link: Stratospheric Aerosol Data Set (SADS Version 2) Prospectus
HistoricalStratosphericAerosol.description: Apply historical stratospheric aerosol concentrations from the stratospheric aerosol data set (SADS Version 2)
HistoricalStratosphericAerosol.label: Historical Stratospheric Aerosol

IdealisedDeforestation.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
IdealisedDeforestation.description: Decrease in forest area and increase in natural grassland from pre-industrial. 20 million square km forest area (covered by trees) is converted to natural unmanaged grassland over a period of 50 years with a linear rate of 400000 km2/yr followed by 30 years of constant forest cover.  Deforestation should be restricted to the top 30% of land grid cells in terms of their area of tree cover.  Effectively this concentrates deforestation in the tropical rainforest and boreal forest regions.  The replacement of forest with natural grassland should be done in such a way that carbon (and nitrogen if applicable) from the forested soil is maintained and allowed to evolve according to natural model processes.  If initial forest cover is less than 20 million square km then linearly remove all the forested area over 50 years and report the total area of forest removed.
IdealisedDeforestation.keywords: LUMIP, idealised deforestation, 20 million square km per year.
IdealisedDeforestation.label: Idealised Deforestation from Forest to Grassland

historicalLandUseLow.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandUseLow.description: Historical land use with low estimates of crop cultivation, pasture land and wood harvest.
historicalLandUseLow.keywords: LUMIP, historical land use, low estimate, crop, pasture, wood harvest
historicalLandUseLow.label: Historical Land Use Low

trendyInterimForcingGSWP3LowLandUse.description: For the interim period from 1700 to the first year of the GSWP3 high land use forcing, the forcing data should continue to be recycled but all other forcings (CO2, etc.) should be as in the piControl simulation. Use high estimates for land use  (crop, pasture and wood harvest).
trendyInterimForcingGSWP3LowLandUse.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, 1700 to first forcing year, interim forcing, GSWP3, low land use
trendyInterimForcingGSWP3LowLandUse.label: TRENDY Interim Forcing for GSWP3 low land use

HistoricalWMGHGConcentrations.description: Forcing data for concentration-driven historical CMIP6 runs. Here, we provide an outline of a consolidated set of atmospheric concentration time series for the long-lived greenhouse-gases, including CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, several ODS, and NF3 to serve as input for the CMIP6 Historical simulations.
HistoricalWMGHGConcentrations.keywords: Historical, Well Mixed Greenhouse Gas, WMGHG
HistoricalWMGHGConcentrations.label: Historical WMGHG Concentrations

historicalLandUseCropPastureAsGrassland.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandUseCropPastureAsGrassland.description: Historical land use except treat all new cropland and pastureland as unmanaged grassland.
historicalLandUseCropPastureAsGrassland.keywords: LUMIP, historical land use, crop and pasture as unmanaged grassland
historicalLandUseCropPastureAsGrassland.label: Historical land use except with crop and pasture as grassland

1850FireManagement.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
1850FireManagement.description: Maintain 1850 levels of fire management (anthropogenic ignition and suppression of fire). If ignitions are based on population density, maintain constant population density.
1850FireManagement.label: 1850 Fire Management

rcp85ForcingExcludingLandUse.description:
Impose RCP8.5 forcing excluding land use.
Emissions driven.
rcp85ForcingExcludingLandUse.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 8.5, future, 21st century, SSP5, RCP8.5, excluding land use
rcp85ForcingExcludingLandUse.label: RCP85 Forcing Excluding Land Use

transientIrrigation.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
transientIrrigation.label: Historical Transient Irrigation

PreIndustrialLandCover.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
PreIndustrialLandCover.label: Pre-Industrial Land Cover

historicalLandUse1850WoodHarvest.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
historicalLandUse1850WoodHarvest.description: Historical land use except maintain 1850 wood harvest amounts/areas. Wood harvest due to land deforestation for agriculture should continue yielding non-zero anthropogenic product pools.
historicalLandUse1850WoodHarvest.keywords: LUMIP, historical land use, pre-industrial wood harvest
historicalLandUse1850WoodHarvest.label: Historical land use except with 1850 wood harvest

FutureSolarIrradiance.data_link: SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMIP6
FutureSolarIrradiance.description: The standard solar forcing dataset recommended for usage is the solar reference scenario dataset which includes future solar forcing (2015-2299).  Includes total solar irradiance, F10.7 cm solar radio flux, and spectral solar irradiance for 10-100000 nm range.
FutureSolarIrradiance.keywords: Solar Forcing, Future, Solar, Spectral Irradiance, SSI, TSI
FutureSolarIrradiance.label: Future Solar Irradiance Forcing

HistoricalAerosolForcing.description: Mass mixing ratio fields at 1x1 degree resolution for main aerosol components (sulphate, black carbon, organic carbon, nitrate, sea salt, mineral dust),  along with effective radius per species.
HistoricalAerosolForcing.label: Historical Aerosol Forcing

Historical greenhouse gas concentrations.description: Here, we provide consolidated data sets of historical atmospheric (volume) mixing ratios of 43 greenhouse gases specifically for the purpose of climate model runs.
Historical greenhouse gas concentrations.name: Historical greenhouse gas concentrations

SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMI.description: An overview of the CMIP6 solar forcing dataset (irradiance as well as particle-related parameters) and guidelines for their usage.
SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMI.name: SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMIP6

Global Soil Wetness Project Phase 3 Webs.description: The 3rd phase of the Global Soil Wetness Project (GSWP3) provides meteorological forcings for the entire 20th Century and beyond.
Global Soil Wetness Project Phase 3 Webs.name: Global Soil Wetness Project Phase 3 Website

Stratospheric Aerosol Data Set (SADS Ver.name: Stratospheric Aerosol Data Set (SADS Version 2) Prospectus

Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land.description: A new set of global gridded land-use forcing datasets are being developed to link historical land-use data and future projections in a standard format required by climate models.
Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land.name: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
